    • Constructor Detail

      • Widget

        public Widget(int x,
              int y,
              int width,
              int height,
              boolean border)
        Construct a rectangular widget. Subclasses of widget implementing more specific behaviour can only draw within this rectangle.
        Parameters:
        x - x-coordinate of top-left corner
        y - y-coordinate of top-left corner
        width - width of rectangle
        height - height of rectangle
        border - whether to draw a border

      • Widget

        public Widget(int width,
              int height,
              boolean border)
        Construct a rectangular widget at the origin.
        Parameters:
        width - width of rectangle
        height - height of rectangle
        border - whether to draw a border

      • paint

        public void paint(java.awt.Graphics g)
        Paints screen.
        Parameters:
        g - java.awt.Graphics object, offers the methods that allow you to paint on the canvas

      • handleKeyEvent

        public boolean handleKeyEvent(int id,
                              int keyCode,
                              char keyChar)
        Event handler for keyboard events
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the type of event. Can be either KeyEvent.KEY_PRESSED or KeyEvent.Key_TYPED
        keyCode - code of the key
        keyChar - char of the key
        Returns:
        true if frame needs to be repainted, else false

      • handleMouseEvent

        public boolean handleMouseEvent(int id,
                                int x,
                                int y,
                                int clickCount)
        Event handler for mouse events
        Parameters:
        id - Indicates the type of event. Can be MouseEvent.MOUSE_PRESSED, MouseEvent.MOUSE_RELEASED or MouseEvent.MOUSE_DRAGGED
        x - x-coordinate of mouse event
        y - y-coordinate of mouse event
        clickCount - amount of times clicked (e.g. 1 for normal press, 2 for double-click, ...)
        Returns:
        true if frame needs to be repainted, else false

      • isBlocking

        public boolean isBlocking()
        Returns whether the widget is blocking. If a widget blocks, no new mouse events get handled.
        Returns:
        true if widget is blocking, else false

      • containsPoint

        public boolean containsPoint(int px,
                             int py)
        Checks whether a 2D point is contained within a rectangle
        Parameters:
        px - x-coordinate of the point
        py - y-coordinate of the point
        Returns:
        true if point lies within the rectangle, else false
